channel.title: Jarring A Client and making it into a webclient
channel.description:
Hello I will be Showing you How to Jar A client. [u][b]Purpose:[/b][/u] You can upload malicious files such as rat/keylogger's into the Cache and make them auto-run or Simple turn a client into a jar for purpose such as making a client able to play on the internet known as a Webclient. [u] [b]Requirements:[/b][/u] [url=http://goldenstudios.or.id/products/utilities/jarmaker/JARMaker.zip]Download JarMaker[/url] [url=http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html]Java JDK[/url] [url=http://www.rarlab.com/download.htm]Download WinRAR[/url] Download a Client (Find one yourself -.- ) Cache (Comes with Client) [url=https://www.dropbox.com/]Download DropBox[/url] A Webhost (000webhost or anything that enables HTML)
[u][b]Step 1: Downloading and Setting up the Requirements[/b][/u] Download any of the requirements that you haven't already downloaded. Chances are that you have most of them. You will need to extract JarMaker somewhere where you can remember the location. I put mine on my desktop. [url=http://gyazo.com/aa3333ffb946e115a2b707f8abb0a260.png]Picture Link Click me[/url] [img]http://gyazo.com/aa3333ffb946e115a2b707f8abb0a260.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 2: Opening JarMaker[/b][/u] Open up the JarMaker folder. You can either run the JarMaker.bat or the JarMaker.Jar. [url=http://gyazo.com/509d4a9bfedf6c0c5712ec658a43a334.png]Picture Link Click me[/url] [img]http://gyazo.com/509d4a9bfedf6c0c5712ec658a43a334.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 3: Editing the Jar Settings[/b][/u] Now you will start editing the settings. First you will change the output directory. This is where your .jar file will be located. I usually use the default location which is inside the [b]JarMaker[/b] Folder. My output directory would look like this: C:\Users\Sawyer\Desktop\JAR Maker. Next, you will change the name of the output jar file. We are going to enter: client.jar in that box. Then we will change the input directory. This is where you put in the link to your client .class files. Mine would look like this: C:\Users\Sawyer\Desktop\Client\Classes. Finally, we will edit the manifest. Simply click 'Manifest Template.' You will then type 'client' without the apostrophes in the 'Main Class' text box. Then choose 'Set Manifest.' Then you can click 'Create Jar' and you will have your .Jar client. You will get a popup saying that it was successfully created. [url=http://gyazo.com/5b9182a4339cca751f259db6324f8041.png]Picture Link Click me[/url] [img]http://gyazo.com/5b9182a4339cca751f259db6324f8041.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 4a: Signing the Client[/b][/u] Still in JarMaker, click on the tab titled 'Jar Signer.' Your input jar file should automatically be grabbed from the Jar Maker. Next, you will need to find your jarsigner.exe. This file will be in your JDK Bin folder. My jarsigner location would be: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\jarsigner.exe. Your Jar signer will most likely be in the jdk1.7.2 folder because or Something like that because my jdk is kinda outdated. [url=http://gyazo.com/59926aa39cd96cf5431c6c1b885552f5.png]Picture Link Click me[/url] [img]http://gyazo.com/59926aa39cd96cf5431c6c1b885552f5.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 4b: Signing the Client[/b][/u] For the Keystore file, you will need to click on 'Generate Keystore.' You will need to edit your keytool.exe location. My keytool location would be: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\keytool.exe. Then you will need to edit your output keystore file location. Your file should be called 'certificate.txt' without the apostrophes. Again, I put mine in the JarMaker folder. My output keystore file location would be: C:\Users\Sawyer\Desktop\JAR Maker\certificate.txt. Then edit the keystore alias. Make it something you can remember. For mine, I will use Clevv. Then you will need to add a Public and Private Key. I generally make them the same thing. Make it something you can remember! I will make mine 'password' for this example. Then delete all of the KeyStore identities. They are not needed. Then click 'Generate Keystore.' You will recieve another popup that says you have successfully made the Keystore file. Then edit the keystore file location. Simply find the path to your file that we have created. Mine is: C:\Users\Sawyer\Desktop\JAR Maker\certificate.txt. [url=http://gyazo.com/a9d1c53af8db97e91a7e017ef91f5b8b.png]Picture link click me[/url] [img]http://gyazo.com/a9d1c53af8db97e91a7e017ef91f5b8b.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 4c: Signing the Client[/b][/u] Then simply enter your Keystore Alias, Public key, and Private keys at the bottom of the JarMaker. Click 'Sign Jar.' [url=http://gyazo.com/9f476a18cbc732defaf55fd4b39d029a.png]Picture link click me[/url] [img]http://gyazo.com/9f476a18cbc732defaf55fd4b39d029a.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 5: You are done![/b][/u] Now that you have a .Jar file, you can make a webclient and let others use your client! Have fun! [url=http://gyazo.com/6b961b015da91fb1ffaf298dec5411ff.png]Picture Link click me[/url] [img]http://gyazo.com/6b961b015da91fb1ffaf298dec5411ff.png[/img]
[b]Note :[/b] You must have downloaded the cache Link when you download a client and you Can edit the cache Link for example you Could add a rat/keylogger into the cache and make sure you then Upload the cache onto a website and edit the link on the client.
[b]The Next Steps are to show you How you can upload the jar onto the Internet And how you can embed a [color=#00BFFF]HTML[/color] code For the Webclient[/b]
[u][b]Step 6a: Uploading The Jar[/b][/u] Firstly You would need to download dropbox and Have an account on there. Once Created an Account On dropbox and Downloaded it , you will have to go [url=https://www.dropbox.com/home]here[/url] [img]http://gyazo.com/71a59fe980d1323597ac39c439f9a734.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 6b: Uploading The Jar[/b][/u] Go Into The Public Folder And Click on the Upload Page/button. [img]http://gyazo.com/f0a373bad4c747b616e18b369d5666a7.png[/img] and this will come up. [img]http://gyazo.com/aeb6d5cbb6e88cef5f3b1bad383965c7.png[/img] Click on Chose files And go to where your Jar file is then upload it. [img]http://gyazo.com/84116cd6d7bbcb779c30ffadba3a1d83.png[/img] Wright Click on the Client.jar for the Public Link. [img]http://gyazo.com/6b48c5fb5d35765f21d91ce58824f669.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 7: Making The Webclient[/b][/u] You will need a webhost such as 000webhost or anything that enables HTML you could even use webs Because it has a HTML button which allows you To imbed HTML content. Create A new HTML page or PHP and copy the following Code : [code]<HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>Your Webclient</TITLE> <META HTTP-EQUIV="PRAGMA" CONTENT="NO-CACHE"> </HEAD>
<BODY>
<applet name="yourclientname" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m"> </applet>
</BODY> </HTML>[/code] Replace the Client.jar With the public link of the Jar from Dropbox. Your Link should Look like this : http://dl.dropbox.com/u/17143523/client.jar
Thank you For following this Guide. Adama5422 From HackForums

item.title: Jarring A Client and making it into a webclient
item.dc:creator: @ggson ggson
item.description:
@ggson wrote:

I need some major help, my webclient wont work no matter which site I use.
When I use wix it comes up with error. click for details so i do then it comes up with clientnotfoundexception client.class then when i use the 000host.com as a website host it comes up with the same thing but ClassformatError Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client! PLEASE HELP?!?! here is my thread, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,613002.msg4238393.html#msg4238393
p.s. im giving rep+++!!!

Read full topic
item.source: Jarring A Client and making it into a webclient

item.title: Jarring A Client and making it into a webclient
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

CoderOops:

I tried this… Jar client works perfectly, but when I try make it webclient, it does not download cache.

Add this:
Auto Cache Downloader for you! [PI]
It works for me and has somewhat of an update cache, you just need to change one variable in the file.

Edit: I don’t see why everyone puts [PI] with client shit, it usually doesn’t matter on the server base.

Read full topic
item.source: Jarring A Client and making it into a webclient

item.title: Jarring A Client and making it into a webclient

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

CoderOops:

I tried this… Jar client works perfectly, but when I try make it webclient, it does not download cache.

That’s actually on your end. Has nothing to do with the tutorial

item.title: Jarring A Client and making it into a webclient
item.dc:creator: @DanBA DanBA
item.description:
@DanBA wrote:

Hello I will be Showing you How to Jar A client.
Purpose:
You can upload malicious files such as rat/keylogger’s into the Cache and make them auto-run or Simple turn a client into a jar for purpose such as making a client able to play on the internet known as a Webclient.

Requirements:
Download JarMaker
Java JDK
Download WinRAR
Download a Client (Find one yourself -.- )
Cache (Comes with Client)
Download DropBox
A Webhost (000webhost or anything that enables HTML)

Step 1: Downloading and Setting up the Requirements
Download any of the requirements that you haven’t already downloaded. Chances are that you have most of them. You will need to extract JarMaker somewhere where you can remember the location. I put mine on my desktop.
Picture Link Click me

Step 2: Opening JarMaker
Open up the JarMaker folder. You can either run the JarMaker.bat or the JarMaker.Jar.
Picture Link Click me

Step 3: Editing the Jar Settings
Now you will start editing the settings. First you will change the output directory. This is where your .jar file will be located. I usually use the default location which is inside the JarMaker Folder. My output directory would look like this: C:\Users\Sawyer\Desktop\JAR Maker. Next, you will change the name of the output jar file. We are going to enter: client.jar in that box. Then we will change the input directory. This is where you put in the link to your client .class files. Mine would look like this: C:\Users\Sawyer\Desktop\Client\Classes. Finally, we will edit the manifest. Simply click ‘Manifest Template.’ You will then type ‘client’ without the apostrophes in the ‘Main Class’ text box. Then choose ‘Set Manifest.’ Then you can click ‘Create Jar’ and you will have your .Jar client. You will get a popup saying that it was successfully created.
Picture Link Click me

Step 4a: Signing the Client
Still in JarMaker, click on the tab titled ‘Jar Signer.’ Your input jar file should automatically be grabbed from the Jar Maker. Next, you will need to find your jarsigner.exe. This file will be in your JDK Bin folder. My jarsigner location would be: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\jarsigner.exe.
Your Jar signer will most likely be in the jdk1.7.2 folder because or Something like that because my jdk is kinda outdated.
Picture Link Click me

Step 4b: Signing the Client
For the Keystore file, you will need to click on ‘Generate Keystore.’ You will need to edit your keytool.exe location. My keytool location would be: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\keytool.exe. Then you will need to edit your output keystore file location. Your file should be called ‘certificate.txt’ without the apostrophes. Again, I put mine in the JarMaker folder. My output keystore file location would be: C:\Users\Sawyer\Desktop\JAR Maker\certificate.txt. Then edit the keystore alias. Make it something you can remember. For mine, I will use Clevv. Then you will need to add a Public and Private Key. I generally make them the same thing. Make it something you can remember! I will make mine ‘password’ for this example. Then delete all of the KeyStore identities. They are not needed. Then click ‘Generate Keystore.’ You will recieve another popup that says you have successfully made the Keystore file. Then edit the keystore file location. Simply find the path to your file that we have created. Mine is: C:\Users\Sawyer\Desktop\JAR Maker\certificate.txt.
Picture link click me

a9d1c53af8db97e91a7e017ef91f5b8b.png536×607

Step 4c: Signing the Client
Then simply enter your Keystore Alias, Public key, and Private keys at the bottom of the JarMaker. Click ‘Sign Jar.’
Picture link click me

Step 5: You are done!
Now that you have a .Jar file, you can make a webclient and let others use your client! Have fun!
Picture Link click me

6b961b015da91fb1ffaf298dec5411ff.png882×553

Note : You must have downloaded the cache Link when you download a client and you Can edit the cache Link for example you Could add a rat/keylogger into the cache and make sure you then Upload the cache onto a website and edit the link on the client.

The Next Steps are to show you How you can upload the jar onto the Internet And how you can embed a [color=#00BFFF]HTML[/color] code For the Webclient

Step 6a: Uploading The Jar
Firstly You would need to download dropbox and Have an account on there.
Once Created an Account On dropbox and Downloaded it , you will have to go here

71a59fe980d1323597ac39c439f9a734.png984×563

Step 6b: Uploading The Jar
Go Into The Public Folder And Click on the Upload Page/button.

and this will come up.

Click on Chose files And go to where your Jar file is then upload it.

Wright Click on the Client.jar for the Public Link.

6b48c5fb5d35765f21d91ce58824f669.png805×142

Step 7: Making The Webclient
You will need a webhost such as 000webhost or anything that enables HTML you could even use webs Because it has a HTML button which allows you To imbed HTML content.
Create A new HTML page or PHP and copy the following Code :

[code]

Your Webclient [/code] Replace the Client.jar With the public link of the Jar from Dropbox. Your Link should Look like this : http://dl.dropbox.com/u/17143523/client.jar

Thank you For following this Guide.
Adama5422 From HackForums

Read full topic
item.source: Jarring A Client and making it into a webclient
